a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b :: real
shows  "(22*a + 60*b) + (10*a + 29*b) - (9*a + 50*b) = 23*a + 39*b"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Simplify $(22a+60b)+(10a+29b)-(9a+50b).$ The final Answer is 23a+39b
 ### Proof
 Distributing the negative sign yields \begin{align} &(22a+60b)+(10a+29b)-(9a+50b)\\ &\qquad=22a+60b+10a+29b-9a-50b\\ &\qquad=22a+10a-9a+60b+29b-50b\\ &\qquad=\boxed{23a+39b}.\end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes a b :: real
shows  "(22*a + 60*b) + (10*a + 29*b) - (9*a + 50*b) = 23*a + 39*b"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Calculate the value of $(22a + 60b) + (10a + 29b) - (9a + 50b)$. The final answer is $23a + 39b$.
